Policy: Ley Nº 5.961 - Preservación del ambiente en todo el territorio de la Provincia de Mendoza.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley introduce el marco normativo para la preservación del medio ambiente y del equilibrio ecológico en todo el territorio provincial. La Ley define los principios que regirán la política ambiental de la Provincia de Mendoza y los lienamientos generales para la relativa planificación ambiental. En lo que respecta al marco institucional, crea el Consejo Provincial del Ambiente. Asimismo, la Ley regula el procedimiento de Evaluación de Impacto Ambiental. Por último, la Ley establece disposiciones en tema de educación ambiental y concientización de la cultura de preservación del medio ambiente.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Americas, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America, South Atlantic

Policy: Land Acquisition Act (Cap. 215).
Policy_Content: This Act provides with respect to the acquisition of land or rights in land for public purposes. The Minister may direct the acquiring officer to investigate in the suitability of land for acquisition and to serve notices of investigation or intended acquisition on the custom owners or persons interested in the land. The Minister shall decide whether that land or easement shall be acquired after having heard possible objections of owners and the acquiring officer's recommendations on those objections. Where the Minister decides under section 4 that a particular land or easement should be acquired under this Act, he or she shall make a written declaration to that effect.  Other provisions concern compensation and other procedures for the taking of possession by the State and appeals to the Supreme Court.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Least Developed Countries, Melanesia, Oceania, Small Island Developing States, South Pacific

Policy: Ley Nº 8/1992 - Modernización y mejora de las estructuras de las tierras de regadío.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto mejorar la estructura de las explotaciones agrarias de regadío en Extremadura, mediante el establecimiento de instrumentos jurídicos que permitan incrementar las dimensiones de aquellas explotaciones sin una base territorial suficiente, e impedir las divisiones de la propiedad que producirían nuevas parcelas de superficie menor al umbral de rentabilidad. La Ley establece un Registro de Explotaciones Agrarias de Regadío que deberá identificar y recoger todos los datos referentes a dichas explotaciones. El capítulo III establece cuatro clases de tierras de regadío debiéndose fijar mediante Decreto los criterios técnicos que permitirán atribuir una tierra determinada a la clase correspondiente. La Ley otorga especial atención a las explotaciones comunitarias (cap. IV), a las que se podrán extender los derechos y deberes establecidos, si así lo solicitaren, para las explotaciones familiares agrarias, y a las explotaciones familiares agrarias (cap. V), entendiéndose por tales, todas aquellas que tengan como base territorial parcelas procedentes de transformaciones en regadío efectuadas por iniciativa del Estado o la Comunidad Autónoma y cuyos propietarios fueran personas físicas en el momento en que se les adjudicó la propiedad, se les reconoció el derecho a adquirirla o a mantenerla en régimen de reserva.

Policy: Ley Nº 5/1992 - Ordenación de las producciones agrarias en Extremadura.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley es producto de la reforma de la Política Agraria Comunitaria que ha obligado a establecer un nuevo marco legal compatible tanto con las normativas comunitarias como con las del Estado. La Ley se divide en trece capítulos, de los cuales el primero se dedica a determinar las competencias de la Administración Regional, entre las que se encuentra la aplicación eficaz de las normas y reglamentos de la Comunidad Económica Europea en materia de Organización Común de los Mercados Agrarios, así como las relativas a la mejora de la eficacia de las estructuras productivas agrarias. La Ley crea un Registro de Explotaciones Agrarias, que contendrá información relativa a superficies de siembra y previsiones de ganadería y superficies destinadas al aprovechamiento directo del ganado y otros. La Ley prevé el otorgamiento de subvenciones para las explotaciones tanto de regadío como de secano. Asimismo, prevé un apoyo prioritario a los proyectos de establecimientos industriales o comerciales promovidos por Sociedades Cooperativas, Sociedades Agrarias de Transformación, Agrupaciones de Productores Agrarios y demás entidades asociativas agrarias que comercialicen sus producciones bajo marcas comerciales. En cuanto a los cultivos de regadío, se incentiva la diversificación de la oferta en el sector maicero, se apoya el cultivo de la remolacha azucarera en el período transitorio establecido en el Tratado de adhesión de España a la CEE. El capítulo IV prevé líneas de ayuda, con una subvención del 45 porciento, para facilitar la mecanización de los cultivos intensivos de regadío, en particular los de tomate, tabaco, pimiento, hortícolas y frutales. Con respecto a los cultivos de secano, la Ley prevé líneas de ayuda para aquellos no incluidos dentro de la nueva política agraria común, subvencionando asimismo con un 45 porciento la adquisición de maquinaria para la recolección mecánica de aceituna y de uva. En cuanto a las producciones ganaderas, la Ley fomenta el asociacionismo ganadero y prevé subvenciones para aquellos ganaderos asociados o que se asocien en el año siguiente a la promulgación de la Ley, en Cooperativas, Sociedades Agrarias de Transformación (SAT), Agrupaciones de Productores Agrarias (APAS), Asociaciones Ganaderas y, en general, en cualquier entidad asociativa agraria que facturen como mínimo 100 millones de pesetas. El capítulo VIII de la Ley se ocupa de a las producciones forestales, otorgando un especial tratamiento a la vegetación autóctona. Los capítulos IX, X, XI, XII y XIII están dedicados respectivamente a los aprovechamientos ganaderos en terrenos libres, la sanidad animal, la sanidad vegetal, medidas de acompañamiento, y por último, normativa sancionadora. La Ley contempla con gran rigor y exigencia tanto el tratamiento de las plagas vegetales como el saneamiento de la cabaña ganadera.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: National Agricultural Seeds Act.
Policy_Content: An Act to provide for the establishment of the National Agricultural Seed Council and various bodies under the control and supervision of the Council, to provide for the certification of agricultural seeds and otherwise regulate the trade in agricultural seeds. "Agricultural seeds" is defined in section 38. The Act consists of 39 sections divided into 5 Parts: Establishment, etc. of the National Agricultural Seeds Council (I); National Seed Service Unit and other bodies of the Council, etc. (II); Staff of the Council (II); Financial provisions (IV); Miscellaneous (V). The Council is established as a body corporate under section 1. The Council shall promote seed development and the seed industry in general and carry out the functions specified in section 3. The following bodies are established under the Council: the National Seed Service Unit, which shall be responsible for the certification and quality control of seeds (sect. 6); the Crop Variety Registration and Release Committee, which shall advise the Council on registration and release of crop varieties (sect. 7); the Seed Standards Committee, which shall make recommendations to the Council on seed standards (sect. 8), and the Seed Industry and Skill Development Committee, which shall advise the Council on seed industry development (sect. 9). The Council shall have five operating zones and for each zone there shall be a secretariat headed by a director (sect. 11). Trade in agricultural seeds of "any notified kind or variety" requires a seed certificate that may be obtained from the National Seed Service Unit (sect. 12). Section 14 concerns the genetic identity of certified seeds. Sections 15 to 20 provide for matters relative to trade in and placing on the market of seeds including importation and exportation of seeds and labelling of seeds. Sections 21 to 24 concern the production and collection of agricultural seeds. There shall be maintained a register of persons and organizations licensed to engage in seed production or marketing according to the classification specified in section 21.
Subject: Forestry, Cultivated plants

Policy: Decree-Law No. 259/92 governing entities empowered to act in the field of the environment.
Policy_Content: The basic Law on the environment prescribes authorizations for the construction, extension, installation and operation of any establishments in which polluting activities are performed. To enforce this Law properly, the entities responsible for conducting statutory tests, appraisals or inspections, in order to assess the issuing of authorizations, must be empowered by the administration, and procedures for issuing their approval must be specifically defined. This is the purpose of this Decree which governs the accredited entities, laying down the criteria for recognising their status, and establishing the procedure for their approval. An approved entity is a legal person, duly approved and registered, equipped with the necessary technical and human resources to perform its functions under this Decree. Depending upon the areas of competence, it may operate in the fields of water, air, waste or noise. The approval is granted to entities by ministerial decision after investigations have been conducted into their facilities, qualifications, independence and impartiality. Such enterprises have the power to: issue opinions on projects for installations or for modifying industrial establishments; ascertaining conformity with technical pollution control standards; drafting new technical standards for measuring pollution levels; evaluating the effectiveness of technical solutions for pollution control; regularly inspecting the operation of industrial establishments; carrying out environmental quality surveys, etc.
Subject: Environment gen., Water

Policy: Nova Scotia Offshore Petroleum Drilling Regulations (S.O.R./92-676).

The text consists of 203 articles divided into 10 Parts as follows: General (I); Approval to drill or approval to re-enter a well or to drill a test hole (II); Operational requirements (III); Safety and training of personnel (IV); Operational records and reports (V); Well evaluation (VI); Well or test hole termination (VII); Deposition of samples from a well (VIII); Final Well Reports (IX); Offences (X).

Policy: Ordonnance sur la mensuration officielle (OMO).
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance met en exécution la loi du 5 octobre 2007 sur la géoinformation. L’article 1er établit que la mensuration officielle désigne les mensurations approuvées par le canton et reconnues par la Confédération qui sont exécutées en vue de l’établissement et de la tenue du registre foncier. Les données de la mensuration officielle sont des géodonnées de référence utilisées par des autorités fédérales, cantonales et communales, des milieux économiques, des milieux scientifiques et des tiers pour obtenir des géoinformations. Le texte comprend 58 articles répartis en 9 chapitres comme suit: Dispositions générales (1er); Contenu de la mensuration officielle (2); Abornement (3); Premier relevé, renouvellement et mise à jour (4); Premier relevé, renouvellement et mise à jour (5); Accès et utilisation (6); Organisation et exécution (7); Indemnités de la Confédération et frais restants (8); Dispositions finales (9).

Section 3 establishes complex arrangements for raising and conservation of soil fertility. Section 4 establishes arrangements for improvement and rehabilitation of degraded and polluted soil. Section 5 regards realization of the Program of raising soil fertility. Section 6 deals with support of the Program. Section 7 regards organizational and legal backing of the Program.

Policy: Law No.2780-XII of 1992 on urban construction.
Policy_Content: The present Law establishes legal, economic, social and organizational principles for urban construction activity and is aimed at formation of valuable living environment and ensuring at the same time protection of natural environment, rational use of natural resources and conservation of cultural heritage. The document consists of 6 sections that contain 28 articles. Section 1 (arts. 1-6) lays down general provisions. Section 2 (arts. 7-15) regards state regulation in the sphere of urban construction. Section 3 (arts. 16-19) establishes state standards, norms and regulations in the sphere of urban construction and regards urban construction documentation. Section 4 (arts. 20-23) regards land relations in the sphere of urban construction and keeping cadastre of urban settlements. Section 5 (arts. 24-26) regards state control in the sphere of urban construction and establishes liability for the infringement of legislation on urban construction. Section 6 (arts. 27-28) regards international relations in the sphere of urban construction.

Policy: Regulation No. 125/92 approving the constitution of the National Institute of Agriculture and Livestock (INFA "Instituto Nacional de Fomento Agro-Pecuário").
Policy_Content: This Regulation implements Decree-Law No. 33/92 of 16 April 1992 which creates INFA as an indirect administration organ under the jurisdiction of the Ministerial Agricultural Secretariat. The constitution describes its responsibilities, competencies, organization and activities which is divided into 6 chapters. Chapter I concerns competencies, duties and research purposes of INFA in the field of agriculture and livestock resources, which include the diffusion of new techniques in respect of the Cape Verdean environment. INFA is responsible for technical assistance to agricultural producers and companies and also for the coordination between other entities subject to the Ministry of Fisheries and Agriculture (MPAAR "Ministério das Pescas, Agricultura e Animação Rural"). If considered necessary, INFA may make agreements for cooperation with national, foreign, or international entities. Chapter II deals with structure by listing composition and duties of each local administrative council. Chapter III regulates matters related to financial management, taxes, etc. Chapter V concerns monitoring implementation of the Regulation.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock

Policy: Regulation No. 124/92 approving the constitution of the National Institute of Rural Engineering and Forests (INERF
Policy_Content: This Regulation implements Decree-Law No. 33/92 of 16 April 1992 which creates INERF as an indirect administration organ under the jurisdiction of the Ministerial Agricultural Secretariat. The constitution defines its responsibilities, competencies, organization and activities and is divided into 6 chapters. Chapter I concerns competencies, duties and research purposes of INERF in the field of forestry resources. The main purpose of INERF is the development of rural techniques for a better exploitation of agricultural resources. It promotes and develops the planning and implementation of projects in rural development and soil conservation. If considered necessary, INERF may conclude agreements with national, foreign, or international entities. Chapter II describes the structure, by listing composition and duties of each local administrative council. Chapter III regulates matters related to financial management, taxes, etc. Chapter V concerns monitoring implementation of this Regulation. Chapter VI contains final and transitional provisions.

Policy: Swaziland Environment Authority Act 1992 (No. 15 of 1992).
Policy_Content: The Act makes provision for the establishment of the Swaziland Environment Authority, whose functions shall be, inter alia, to: (a) establish standards and guidelines relating to all forms of environmental pollution; (b) assist the Minister responsible for environmental protection in formulating policies relating to environmental matters; (c) develop economic measures in order to encourage environmentally sound and sustainable activities; (d) coordinate the activities of all bodies engaged in environmental protection and promote studies, surveys, research, training and education programmes; (e) ensure the observance of proper safeguards in the planning and execution of all development projects; (f) establish guidelines for preparing Environmental Impact Assessment on all development projects; (g) control all forms of pollution; (h) carry out measures for the coordination and enforcement of environmental protection legislation and of international conventions. Further provisions concern the composition and the rules of procedure of the Authority, the appointment of committees and the immunity from civil liability of member or staff of the Authority.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Access to Neighbouring Land Act 1992.
Policy_Content: Where a person: (a) requires entry to land, other than a highway, for the purpose of carrying out work on other land; and; (b) the land on which he or she requires entry is adjoining or adjacent to the land in respect of which he or she wishes to carry out the work; and (c) he or she does not have the agreement of another person whose agreement to the entry is required -the first-mentioned person may apply to the court for an order authorising access to the subject land on such occasions and during such period as may be specified in the order. The court may make an access order if it is satisfied that the work for which entry is sought is reasonably necessary for the preservation of the land in respect of which the work is to be carried out, and that other requirements regarding access are fulfilled. Rights and obligation of the person requiring access are set out in section 7. In addition to any other remedy, the court may make an order for payment of damages by a party to the proceedings who fails to comply with a requirement of an access order or of section 7 (sect. 8). (16 sections)
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Land Acquisition Act (No. 5 of 1992).
Policy_Content: An Act to provide for the acquisition of land or rights in land for public purposes. The Minister may direct the acquiring officer to investigate in the suitability of land for acquisition and to serve notices of investigation or intended acquisition on the custom owners or persons interested in the land. The Minister shall decide whether that land or easement shall be acquired after having heard possible objections of owners and the acquiring officer's recommendations on those objections. Where the Minister decides under section 4 that a particular land or easement should be acquired under this Act, he shall make a written declaration to that effect. The declaration shall be notified to the persons interested. Other provisions concern compensation and other procedures for the taking of possession by the State and appeals to the Lands Referee and the Supreme Court.

No person shall, except where that person practices zero grazing, graze his animal in an urban area (reg. 3). "Urban farming" means the carrying out of plant or animal husbandry activities as set out in the Schedule within statutory township boundaries. Regulation 4 prohibits farming which may cause nuisance in other zones as those destined for urban farming. (4 regulations)

Policy: Mine Safety Law of the People's Republic of China.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the Act is to ensure production safety and to prevent accidents in mines, as well as to promote the development of the mining industry. The Law consists of 50 articles divided into 8 Chapters: General Provisions (I); Guarantees for Safety in Mine Construction (II); Guarantees for Safety in Exploitation of Mines (III); Safety Management of Mining Enterprises (IV); Supervision and Control over Safety in Mines (V); Disposition of Accidents at Mines (VI); Legal Liabilities (VII); Supplementary Provisions (VIII). The competent department of labour administration under the State Council shall exercise unified supervision over the work of safety control throughout the country (art.4). The State encourages research in science and technology relating to safety in mines, popularizes advanced technology, improves safety facilities and enhances the level of safe production in mines (art.5). The design papers for mine construction projects must comply with the safety rules and technological standards for mining industry and shall be subject to the approval of the authorities in charge of mining enterprises (art.8). For exploitation of mines, requirements that ensure safe production must be met, and the safety rules and technological standards for mining industry corresponding to the exploitation of different types of minerals must be observed (art.13). Chapter IV deals with safety management in mining enterprises; Chapters V and VI set out duties for the supervision and control of mining safety as well as rules and procedures for handling mining accidents. The Law includes specific penalties for non-compliance.

Policy: National Cooperatives Development Board Act, 2049 (1992)
Policy_Content: This Act, consisting of 20 sections, creates the National Cooperatives Development Board in order to support the development of various types of cooperative associations and unions at the national level by making and formulating policies and plans on services and facilities for the economic and social development of the lower level people in consonance with the cooperative principle. It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Board, entitled to perform the following activities: a) formulate policies required for the promotion and development of cooperative associations and unions through cooperative at the national level; render necessary assistance in the formulation of policies on the development of cooperatives and development plans pertaining thereto, and implement such policies; c) carry out necessary study and research works on the development of cooperatives; d) set up a cooperative development fund with a view to providing loans or grants to cooperative associations and unions in an easily accessible manner and to provide, or cause to be provided, out of the fund, necessary capital to cooperative associations and unions for the operation of development-oriented works; e) invest in the shares of cooperative associations and unions or cooperative banks; f) provide assistance if required to any cooperative associations or unions of the Board in borrowing loans from any native banks or other bodies; g) provide technical assistance to make necessary arrangements on the operation of programmes related with the development of cooperative associations and unions and promote and protect the cooperative associations and unions; h) establish harmony among various bodies of the Government, cooperative associations and unions and non-governmental organizations, and render support to make such associations or organizations more encouraged in professional programmes.

Policy: Forest Law (State Law and Order Restoration Council Law No. 8/92).
Policy_Content: The basic principles underlying this Law include implementing the forestry and environmental conservation policies of the Government and developing the State's economy to provide food, and other needs. Under this Law, all standing teak trees, regardless of location, are owned by the State. The Minister may create or alter reserved and protected public forests on land at the disposal of the Government. Reserved forests may be demarcated under the Law for commercial extraction, local supply, watershed or catchment, environment and biodiversity, or other purposes. Protected public forests may be declared to protect soil and water, maintain sustained yield of forest produce, and conserve dry-zone forests, mangrove forests, environment and biodiversity. Procedures are prescribed for determining the affected rights of the public in the demarcation and declaration process. Reserved forests created under the Forest Act, 1902, are deemed to be reserved forests under the new Law. The Law sets out the functions and responsibilities of the Forestry Department. Permits are required for extracting or moving forest produce and establishing wood-based industries. For each extraction permit, the variety of minor forest produce, quantity of each kind of forest produce, etc. are determined and terms and conditions prescribed. Subject to certain execptions, commercial scale extraction permits are granted for various period and competitive bidding is required for extraction on a commercial scale. Holders of permits for extraction on a commercial scale are financially responsible for any reforestation conditions, either by establishing forest plantations or through natural regeneration. Penalties are provided for the following actions within a reserved forest: trespassing by humans or domestic animals, pasturing domestic animals, clearing land without a permit, hunting or fishing, and setting fires. Felling, cutting, girdling, marking, lopping, tapping or injuring by fire or otherwise any tree in a reserved forest is punishable.

Policy: Provisional guidelines for the calculation of emissions of pollutants to the atmospheric air as a result of combustion of solid domestic waste at the testing sites and the amount of compensation therefore.
Policy_Content: These Provisional guidelines are destined for the territorial bodies of the Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources. Combustion of solid domestic waste shall be considered emergency emission and tenfold rate of environmental fees shall be applicable thereto. Basic bulk weight of solid domestic waste shall be calculated as equal to 0.25 tonnes per cubic metre. Coefficient of ecological situation and ecological value shall be applicable to the calculation of the amount of compensation. Enterprises, institutions, organizations and officials responsible for the combustion of dumps shall be retained ecological offenders and shall be subject to administrative fines.

Policy: Central Valley Project Improvement Act (P.L 102-575).
Policy_Content: This Part of Division 6 of the Water Code of California concerns improved management of water resources of the Central Valley Project for purposes of mitigation, protection, and restoration of fish and wildlife. It has the following purposes: (a) To protect, restore, and enhance fish, wildlife, and associated habitats in the Central Valley and Trinity River basins of California; (b) to address impacts of the Central Valley Project on fish, wildlife and associated habitats; (c) to improve the operational flexibility of the Central Valley Project; (d) to increase water-related benefits provided by the Central Valley Project to the State of California through expanded use of voluntary water transfers and improved water conservation; (e) to contribute to the State of California's interim and long-term efforts to protect the San Francisco Bay/Sacramento-San Joaquin Delta Estuary; (f) to achieve a reasonable balance among competing demands for use of Central Valley Project water, including the requirements of fish and wildlife, agricultural, municipal and industrial and power contractors.

Policy: Hawaii Tropical Forest Recovery Act (Public Law 102-574).
Policy_Content: This Act amends the International Forestry Cooperation Act of 1990. It establishes the Hawaii Experimental Tropical Forest which will be managed as a model for sustainable yield harvesting and natural resources conservation as well as for research and outreach. In addition, the secretary of Agriculture is authorized to provide assistance through the Forest Service to eligible entities in States with tropical forests to promote sound management and conservation of tropical forests of the United States. Eligible entities include governments and private persons. The Act also establishes the Hawaii Tropical Forest Recovery Task Force to advise the Secretary of Agriculture on tropical forests and related ecosystems in the State of Hawaii. Within one year of its first meeting, the Task Force will submit an action plan with findings and recommendations for rejuvenating Hawaii's tropical forests, including forest land restoration methods, compatible multiple uses within tropical forests, protection of native plants and animals from non-native species, coordination of Federal, State and private forestry programmes as well as traditional practices, uses, and needs of native Hawaiians in tropical forests. The Secretary is then required to submit an additional plan to expand and construct additional required research, training and outreach facilities within one year of the receipt of the Task Force's action plan. Annual reports are required on the progress, needs and long-range plans of the Institutes of Tropical Forestry in meeting the requirements of the Global Climate Change Prevention Act of 1990.

Policy: Regional Ecological Code (No BC-13/28 of 1992).
Policy_Content: The Regional Law consists of 15 Sections that contain 95 articles. The present Ecological Code establishes legal, economic and social basis for the organization of environmental protection in the interests of the present and the future generations. The purpose of the regional ecological legislation are legal regulation in the sphere of protection, utilization and reproduction of natural resources, ensuring ecological safety, prevention of negative environmental impact of economic activity, conservation of natural resources, genetic fund of the animate nature, landscapes and other objects of nature representing cultural heritage. Ecosystems, ozone layer, land, subsoil, surface and groundwater, atmospheric air, forests and other vegetation, wildlife, genetic fund and natural landscapes are under protection against pollution, spoilage, damage, exhaustion and depletion. State nature reserves, National Parks, rare and endangered plants and animals, and their natural habitats are posted under special protection (Art. 5). The state shall guarantee ecological rights of citizens and ecological and other social associations in the sphere of environmental protection (Art. 16). Contract on complex nature management, envisaging the payment of environmental fees, shall be concluded by the local administration and nature manager after environmental audit. Nature management shall be carried out in conformity with licence issued by the regional authorities (Art. 20). Basic ecological education shall be compulsory in the pre-school, high school and academies (Art. 76).

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 828 of 1992 regarding the validation of the Regulations on the Procedure and Terms for Charging Mineral, Water Area and Seabed Royalties.
Policy_Content: This Decree validates the attached Regulations for Charging Mineral, Water Area and Seabed Royalties. It establishes that the interim minimum rates of mineral royalties validated by the Ministerial Decree No.478 of 1992 shall operate until a specific amount of such regular payments has been fixed on each exploited deposit in accordance with the Regulations on Mineral Deposits, validated by the Supreme Soviet on July 15, 1992. This Regulation lays down the procedure and terms for charging mineral, water area and seabed royalties, as well as the criteria for fixing the rates of such payments. The Law on Mineral Deposits provides for charges for the reproduction of sources of mineral raw materials, licence-issue levies and excise duties, the amount, method and terms of charging, to be determined by appropriate normative documents. Mineral royalties include charges for mineral prospecting, exploration and development rights and also payments for the right to construct and operate non-mining underground structures. Mineral, water area and seabed royalties are charged from all mineral users. Exemptions shall be effected in accordance with the Article 40 of the Law On Mineral Lands and Resources.

Policy: Regional Law No. VS-13/26 Subsoil Code.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Subsoil Code shall be to ensure complex rational management and protection of subsoil, protection of the interests of the state and the citizens, and also of the rights of subsoil managers. Regional subsoil, including underground, minerals, energy and other resources, shall be state property. Regional subsoil shall be used for exploration, prospecting, research and mining for the purpose of extraction of mineral resources. Subsoil can be conceded either for performance of a single of the aforesaid activities or for a combination of some of them. Subsoil management shall be subject to mandatory licensing. Subsoil manager of possession of a concession for subsoil operations shall have exclusive rights for subsoil management and exploitation within the boundaries set forth in the licence. Concession for subsoil operation can be issued for a limited period of time or it can be open-ended.

Policy: Ecological Code (Regional Law No. VS-13/28).
Policy_Content: The scope of this Ecological Code shall be to ensure environmental protection, rational management of natural resources and environmental security as mandatory condition for sustainable economic and social development of the region. Objects of environmental protection shall be: (a) land, soil, subsoil; (b) surface water and groundwater; (c) forests, flora and fauna and genetic fund thereof; (d) atmospheric air, ozone layer and outer space. Intact ecosystems, natural landscapes and natural complexes shall be subject to priority protection. Each citizen shall be granted the right to clean and healthy environment. Citizens shall have the duty to protect natural environment and comply with legislative requirements in the sphere of environmental protection. Environmental audit at the regional level shall be performed on voluntary basis.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 641 validating the Regulation on transfer of land.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree regards transfer of land to the category of radioactively contaminated land, removal thereof from practical use, and also exclusion from the category of radioactively contaminated land and transfer thereof to practical use. Radioactively contaminated land shall be considered the plots of land located on the radioactively contaminated territories that cannot ensure manufacturing of agricultural commodities complying with radionuclide contents standard. Radioactively contaminated land recognized unsuitable for economic activity in conformity with the purposeful use thereof shall be classified as land subject to alienation and it can be expropriated in accordance with the established modalities. Use restrictions shall be imposed upon radioactively contaminated land not classified as land subject to alienation. Classification of radioactively contaminated land and transfer of land from one category to another shall be carried out by the Ministry on Emergency Situations.

Policy: Ordonnance nº 92-1140 relative au Code forestier applicable dans la collectivité territoriale de Mayotte.
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance adapte le Code forestier métropolitain à la collectivité territoriale de Mayotte. En la forme, l'ordonnance est structurée de manière quasiment identique à ce Code. Après des dispositions préliminaires, elle comprend cinq livres traitant successivement: du régime forestier; des biens forestiers et agro-forestières des particuliers; de la conservation et de la police des biens forestiers et agro-forestiers en général; des forêts de protection et de la lutte contre l'érosion; de l'inventaire et de la mise en valeur des ressources ligneuses et agro-forestières. Sur le fond, l'ordonnance apporte quelques innovations par rapport au Code forestier métropolitain, dont les principales concernent les points suivants: (1) les biens régis par l'ordonnance sont dits forestiers ou agro-forestiers (alors que le Code parle en général de forêts, bois ou terrains à boiser. Les biens forestiers sont ceux qui portent des essences forestières (tels que forêts, bois, mangroves, terrains à destination forestière et leurs dépendances). Les biens agro-forestiers sont ceux qui, sans être forestiers, portent des essences forestières nécessaires à la conservation des sols et des eaux, concurremment avec des utilisations agricoles; (2) la commission territoriale des forêts est chargée d'élaborer des orientations politiques pour la mise en valeur économique, écologique et sociale des biens forestiers et agro-forestiers, publics et privés, de la collectivité territoriale; (3) les conseils municipaux ou les représentants des communautés usagères doivent être préalablement consultés lors-qu'un projet (tel que boisement ou exploitation de carrières) est susceptible d'affecter durablement l'exercice des droits d'usage sur des biens forestiers ou agro-fores- tiers domaniaux; (4) les droits d'usage ne peuvent être exercés dans les forêts de l'Etat que par ceux dont les droits ont été reconnus fondés par une décision judiciaire ou administrative dans l'année qui suit la promulgation de la présente ordonnance; (5) les propriétaires de biens forestiers et agro-forestiers et les propriétaires riverains de ces mêmes biens ne peuvent se livrer à aucun acte d'exploitation ou de défrichement sans que leurs propriétés aient été préalablement délimitées et bornées; (6) une servitude de passage et d'aménagement, dont l'assiette ne peut excéder quatre mètres, est établie par les autorités compétentes dans le but exclusif d'assurer la continuité des voies de défense contre les incendies de biens forestiers ou agro-forestiers; (7) peuvent être déclarés d'utilité publique, et exécutés dans des périmètres fixés par arrêté, les travaux nécessaires au maintien des terres en pente, à la défense des sols contre l'érosion, à la régularisation du régime des eaux et à l'équilibre écologique de Mayotte.

Policy_Content: This Law establishes that pawn shall be intended to secure of obligations if otherwise is not envisaged by the acting legislation. Pawn shall be regulated by contracts. The object of pledge can be commodities, future harvest, animal yield etc. Envisaged by pawn contract. The Parties of pawn contract can be natural persons, legal persons and the state.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 362 validating the Regulation on the Ministry of Environmental Protection.
Policy_Content: The Ministry of Environmental Protection is the authorized institution in the sphere of environmental protection, rational nature management, hydrometeorology, entitled to carry out the state supervision over the activity  of the ministries, institutions, organizations and enterprises irrespectively of the form of departmental subordination and the form of property (for the physical persons), to carry out the common environmental policy for the purpose of ensuring sustainable socio-economic development and environmental safety of the population. The Ministry and its territorial branches shall form the integral system of monitoring and supervision in the sphere of hydrometeorology, environmental protection and nature management. The Ministry shall have the following tasks: 1) carrying out common state environmental policy in the sphere of land tenure, water management, forestry, mining, the use and the protection of the atmospheric air, the use of wildlife (including fish) and vegetable realm, protected areas and hydrological processes; 2) ensuring access to ecological information regarding the state of environment; 3) early warning system development; 4) organization and coordination of the environmental rate setting. The Ministry shall carry out the following functions: 1) data collection and reporting; 2) granting access to the governmental bodies and the population to environmental information including natural disasters; 3) elaboration and validation of environmental standards; 4) environmental audit.  The Ministry shall issue licences for the following activities: 1) emissions and discharge of pollutants; 2) extraction of minerals; 3) disposal of industrial and domestic waste; 4) special water management; 5) water-well drilling; 6) prospecting.

Policy: Patent Law (No. 3517-1).
Policy_Content: The present Law regulates property and personal non-property relations originating in the process of creation, legal protection and use of inventions, useful patterns and industrial models. The conditions for patentability of an invention envisage that objects of an invention can be: 1) device; 2) method; 3) substance; 4) isolates of micro-organisms; 5) cells of plant and animal origin; 6) use of previously known device, method, substance, isolates of micro-organisms for new purposes. The Law consists of 8 Sections composed of 37 articles. Section 1 (arts. 1-3) lays down general provisions. Section 2 (arts. 4-6) establishes conditions for patentability of the objects of industrial property. Section 3 (arts. 7-9) regards authors and owners of patents. Section 4 (arts. 10-14) establishes the exclusive right of use of inventions, useful models and industrial models. Section 5 (arts. 15-28) establishes the modalities of obtaining patent. Section 6 (arts. 29-30) regards expiry of a patent. Section 7 (arts. 31-32) regards protection of the rights of the owner and the author of patent. Section 8 (arts. 33-37) lays down final provisions.

Policy: Abatement of Nuisance Regulations (Prevention of Noise), 1992
Policy_Content: These regulations, of 19 Sections, establish conditions and make provisions for the regulation of noise in Israel. this document restricts various sources of noise in residential neighborhoods during afternoon hours and at night, prohibit the use of a siren or horn when unnecessary or the running of a vehicle without a muffler, prohibit the use of a loudspeaker or amplifier for advertising purposes in a residential area, and restrict noise caused by air conditioners and alarms. The regulations set a six-minute time restriction on the operation of security alarms. The sound levels generated by such alarms must not exceed 87 dB(A) in a residential area and 95 dB(A) in a non-residential area. Alarms that do not comply with the provisions set in the regulations must be shut off as soon as possible (within 30 minutes). If not shut off, a policemen or a person authorized by the Minister of the Environment may shut off the alarm. The duration of a car alarm must not exceed one minute or three cumulative minutes within a five-minute period. A 1992 amendment to the Abatement of Nuisances Law authorizes the police to take reasonable measures to shut off car alarms after 20 minutes.The regulations also prohibit the operation of air conditioners, compressors and the like in a manner which will cause noise which disturbs or is likely to disturb neighbors or cause unreasonable noise. Producers and importers of air conditions are required to mark the maximum sound level at various distances, outside the building, so that the sound level will not exceed the permissible sound level. Other provisions in the regulations relate to noise made by animals, measurement of sound levels, and noise generated in non-residential areas which creates a disturbance in a residential area.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia

Policy: Official Letter No.VO-61/2296 of 1992 of the Committee on Geology and Use of Subsoil regarding Regulation on the modalities of licensing of subsoil.
Policy_Content: Committee on Geology and Use of Subsoil and its territorial branches are entitled to issue licenses signed by authorized representatives of the aforesaid institution. Committee on Geology and Use of Subsoil and its territorial branches in the process of organization and carrying out activity related to licensing of the use of subsoil must be guided by the following instructions: 1). Licenses for geological study of subsoil are conceded at the stage of prospecting, carried out on the basis of autonomous projects, i.e. excluded from geological survey. Prospecting and valuation of mineral deposits at the expense of state funds must be carried out within the framework of federal and territorial programs, the main data on which are reported by mass media. The main task of tenders held on similar occasions consists in making known enterprises that can guarantee the most efficient utilization of state funds. 2). Territorial branches of Committee on Geology and Use of Subsoil on the basis of available data regarding finances keep record of the plots of subsoil that represent interest as objects of licensing and elaborate the program of licensing that must contain the list of the objects of licensing. Federal Geological Fund is authorized to keep record of licenses issued to foreign users of subsoil, joint ventures and licenses for all types of activity on the continental shelf. Federal and territorial geological funds in the process of registration must control the correctness of filling up licensing documentation and its conformity with the legislation currently in force. In case of exposure of the infringements registration must not be carried out and the licensing authority must be informed.

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 246/92 - Estrategia de conservación para el desarrollo sostenible, ordenamiento ambiental del territorio y plan de acción forestal.
Policy_Content: El deterioro alarmante de la calidad del medio ambiente, de la biodiversidad y de los recursos naturales del país ha hecho necesario adoptar medidas urgentes encaminadas a impedir un agravamiento acelerado de los daños ecológicos. Habida cuenta de ello, el presente Acuerdo declara prioritaria la aplicación de una estrategia de conservación para el desarrollo sostenible, ordenamiento ambiental del territorio y plan de acción forestal. El Gobierno deberá manifestar su apoyo a estos documentos, que serán considerados como principios fundamentales para la elaboración de los planes de acción correspondientes. Además, las instituciones gubernamentales deberán coordinar sus actividades y armonizar sus políticas a la luz de estas estrategias nacionales.

Policy: Decreto Nº 003-92-CDCH ─ Normas para sancionar infracciones ambientales y disuadir de actitudes que atenten contra los recursos naturales, el medio ambiente y la salud humana.
Policy_Content: A tenor del presente Decreto se consideran infracciones ambientales: i) las violaciones al Código del Medio Ambiente y los Recursos Naturales; ii) las violaciones a las legislaciones sectoriales de relevancia ambiental; iii) las violaciones a las disposiciones ambientales municipales del distrito de Chancay. Las sanciones aplicables a estas infracciones son las previstas por las disposiciones pertinentes del Código del Medio Ambiente y los Recursos Naturales y por los textos municipales. Por otra parte, el Decreto prevé que: i) las empresas que omitan de suministrar informaciones relativas a los efluentes o que las falseen serán pasibles de una multa equivalente al 1 por ciento de su capital social; ii) quienes arrojen efluentes susceptibles de poner en grave peligro la salud humana estarán sujetos a la suspensión de la licencia de funcionamiento y a multa.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No.632 validating Regulation on the modalities of calculation of environmental fees and its maximum limits for environmental pollution, waste disposal and other types of hazardous impact.
Policy_Content: The present Regulation regards enterprises, institutions, organizations, foreign legal and natural persons that carry out any kind of activity on the territory of the Russian Federation connected with nature management and envisages collection of environmental fees for the following types of hazardous environmental impact: a) emission in the atmosphere of pollutants from stationary and non-stationary sources; b) discharge of pollutants into surface water and groundwater; c) waste disposal; d) other types of hazardous impact (noise, vibration, electromagnetic impact and radioactive pollution). Two types of basic standard fees are established: 1) for emissions, discharge of pollutants, waste disposal and other types of hazardous impact within the established limits; 2) for emissions, discharge of pollutants, waste disposal and other types of hazardous impact within the established limits (provisional preconcerted standards). Basic standard fees are established for each ingredient of pollutant (waste), taking into account hazardous impact with the consideration for the degree of peril for environment and public health.

Policy_Content: La présente loi régit les rapports de travail entre les travailleurs et les employeurs ainsi qu’entre ces derniers et les apprentis placés sous leur autorité. Policy: Pacific Yew Act (Public Law 102-335)
Policy_Content: This Act is based upon Congressional findings that appropriate management guidelines should be implemented promptly to prevent the wasting of Pacific yew tree species, from which taxol is derived to treat certain types of cancer, while successful and affordable alternative methods of manufacturing taxol are being developed. The Act's requirements expire upon notice to Congress from the Secretaries of Agriculture and Interior, based upon a determination by the Secretary of Health and Human Services, that quantities of taxol sufficient to satisfy medicinal demands are available from sources other than Pacific yew trees harvested on Federal lands. The purpose of the Act is to manage Pacific yew trees located on National Forest lands and on public lands administered by the Bureau of Land Management so that Pacific yew can be collected and utilized efficiently, taxol can be produced commercially and sold at a reasonable cost to cancer patients, and the Pacific yew can be conserved over the long-term. The Secretaries of Agriculture and Interior are required to pursue a conservation and management policy on lands under their respective jurisdictions. The content of this policy stated broadly in the Act includes priorities in planning Pacific yew harvests and specified means of harvesting to minimize any adverse effects on the survival and regeneration of Pacific yew trees. Immediate consultation is specifically required under the Endangered Species Act of 1973 if a Secretary foresees the need to harvest Pacific yew in an area where an opinion under that Act has already concluded that commercial timber sales are likely to jeopardize the continued existence of an endangered or threatened species or destroy or adversely modify critical habitat identified for the species.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 555 regarding validation of the Regulation on the modalities of conservation of degraded agricultural land and land contaminated by toxic industrial waste and by nuclear waste.
Policy_Content: The Government decrees to validate the Regulation. The Committee on Land Reform and Land Resources attached to the Government, the Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources, the Ministry of Agriculture together with other ministries and bodies concerned must provide for systematic activity regarding exposure and conservation of degraded agricultural land and contaminated land and control over carrying out arrangements for their restoration. The present Regulation establishes the modalities of conservation of degraded agricultural land and land contaminated by toxic industrial waste and by nuclear waste for the purpose of their preservation and restoration of soil fertility, improvement of natural conditions and protection of human health. Land is recognized degraded if as consequence of anthropogenic or natural factors there have occurred stable negative processes of change of the state of soil. Land conservation, or provisional exclusion of land from economic turnover is carried out for the purpose of the prevention of development or removal of processes of soil degradation, restoration of soil fertility and rehabilitation of contaminated territories. Conservation regards: a) agricultural land with heavily eroded, heavily saline soils, heavily swamped soils (as a result of flood or infringement of ecological requirements), soil subject to considerable desertification, soft soil as a result of the extraction of minerals, reindeer pastures with heavily damaged ground and vegetable topsoil when the purposeful use of the aforesaid land would lead to further development of the negative processes, deterioration of soil and ecology; b) land contaminated by toxic industrial waste and by nuclear waste over maximum permissible limit.

Policy: Council Regulation (EEC) No. 2158/92 on the protection of the Community's forests against fire.
Policy_Content: In order to provide increased protection for forests and in particular to step up efforts undertaken to maintain and monitor forest ecosystems and to safeguard the various functions which forests fulfil for the benefit of rural areas, a Community scheme for the protection of forests against fire is hereby instituted. The purpose of the scheme is to reduce the number of forest fire outbreaks and to reduce the extent of areas burnt. Member States shall classify their territory according to the degree of forest-fire risk. Member States shall forward to the Commission forest-fire protection plans for the areas classified as high risk and medium risk and shall also provide information on forest-fire protection measures already implemented with a financial contribution from the Community, together with an assessment of the effectiveness of the different types of measures. (12 articles)
Subject: Forestry
Entry into force notes: This Regulation shall enter into force on the third day following that of its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 391 validating the Regulation on the national natural park “Russian North”.
Policy_Content: National natural park “Russian North” is an environmental institution created with the aim of preserving the unique natural and historical complexes of lakes and using them for recreational, environmental, educational and scientific purposes. The main tasks of the natural park shall be as follows: (a) preservation of reference and unique natural complexes and objects; (b) preservation of monuments of history, culture and other objects of cultural heritage; (c) creation of conditions for regulated ecological tourism and recreation in natural conditions; (d) organization of environmental education of the population; (e) development and implementation of scientific methods for the protection of natural and cultural heritage; and (f) restoration, preservation and development of traditions of folk art, the transfer of traditional aesthetic and ethical values to new generations. The tasks listed above are carried out by organizing strict protection of a part of the territory of the national natural park and establishing on the rest of the territory a regime that excludes damage to natural, historical and cultural resources during their economic and recreational use. In the course of work on the creation of the national park, further clarification, adjustment and expansion of the tasks assigned thereto. The following activities prohibited on the territory of the national natural park: (a) any activity that threatens the existence of natural complexes and protected historical and cultural sites; (b) exploration and mining; (c) activities of facilities of the pulp and paper and chemical industries, metallurgy, nuclear power and any other facilities that pose a particular environmental hazard; (d) change the hydrological regime; (e)  introduction of alien species; and (f) final felling and harvesting of resin.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. UP-239 related to setting up local and national special environmental protection funds.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree establishes that special environmental protection funds shall be set up under the supervision of the Ministry of Environmental Protection. Local special environmental protection funds shall be set up through revenues by enterprises, organizations, institutions and other economic entities in the form of: (a) environmental fees; (b) penalties for accidental emission and emergency emission of pollutants; (c) compensation for environmental damages; and (d) voluntary contributions of nature managers. Finances of local special environmental protection funds shall be used for: (a) equity participation in regional and national environmental protection programmes; (b) conservation and restoration of small rivers; (c) development of protected areas; and (d) education. National special environmental protection fund shall be set up through revenues of 25 percent of local special environmental protection funds. Finances of national special environmental protection fund shall be used for development of ecological legislation and regulations, expenditure related to environmental audit and environmental monitoring.

Policy: Decree No. 3314-1 of the Supreme Soviet regarding validation and modalities of enactment of the Regulation on the modalities of licensing of the use of subsoil.
Policy_Content: The Supreme Soviet decrees to validate the Regulation. The present Regulation determines the modalities of licensing of the use of subsoil for geological prospecting, extraction of minerals, construction and exploitation of underground constructions not related to the extraction minerals. The following types of activity are subject to compulsory licensing: regional geological and geophysical work, geological survey, engineering and geological prospecting, scientific research, setting up and conducting environmental monitoring, control over the regime of underground water without considerable damage to the integrity of subsoil. Committee on Geology (GEOLCOM) and its territorial branches are authorized to issue licenses for carrying out the aforesaid activity while the terms of license must be coordinated with the bodies of local self-government. The Act consists of 19 Sections. Section 1 lays down the general provisions. Section 2 regards state system of licensing of the use of subsoil. Section 3 concerns the plots of subsoil conceded in use. Section 4 regards concession of the plots of land. Section 5 deals with the system of payment for the use of subsoil. Section 6 specifies the types of licenses. Section 7 establishes the duration of licenses. Section 8 specifies the contents of licenses. Section 9 regards holders of license. Section 10 establishes the system of selection of candidates for concession of license. Section 11 determines mechanism of issuing licenses. Section 12 determines the particulars of licensing of the use of continental shelf and Exclusive Economic Zone of the Russian Federation. Section 13 determines the modalities of the use of subsoil in particular cases. Section 14 determines the modalities of the use of subsoil for the purpose of extraction of underground water and disposal of hazardous substances, waste residues of the disposal of effluent water in subsoil. Section 15 establishes the grounds for the cessation of the right to the use of subsoil. Section 16 establishes the main rights and duties of the holders of license. Section 17 determines conditions for invalidation of licenses. Section 18 establishes control over the observance of the conditions of the use of subsoil determined in license. Section 19 regards issuing of licenses to the enterprises who had been using subsoil before the enactment of the present Regulation.
Subject: Mineral resources, Water
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 491 validating the Regulation on land monitoring.

Policy: Law on Land Privatisation in Rural Areas (1992)
Policy_Content: The Law lays down rules for privatisation of land in rural areas. The main tasks of land privatisation are to create the basis and guarantees for agricultural development; to restore the land ownership rights to the former owners of land, which belonged to them on 21 July 1940 or to the heirs thereof; and to transfer land into ownership with remuneration to the citizens of the Republic of Latvia. Land privatisation in rural areas must be carried out, conforming to the following basic principles: land privatisation shall take place, in conformity with the Law On Land Reform in Rural Areas of the Republic of Latvia; upon privatisation of land, the lawful interests of the present owners of buildings and structures, users of land, as well as of the State and local governments must be observed; forests, perennial plants growing on it and surface waters, except the public waters, must be privatised together with land; land must be transferred into ownership to the citizens of the Republic of Latvia and to legal persons registered in Latvia; and land privatisation must take place on the basis of a request of the citizens of the Republic of Latvia or legal persons registered in Latvia, on a voluntary basis.

Policy: Regulation No. 415/1992 of the Slovak Geological Institute on granting the license on the execution of the geological works and verification of the expert competence of the workers.
Policy_Content: This Regulation modifies the details: on granting the license on the execution of geological works. This Regulation is related to geological works that are mining activities or activities executed in a mining way. The execution, projection and evaluation of such geological works that are not mining activities or activities executed in a mining way, is related to a separate legal order. The application for granting the permission to execute geological works or the application for its change will be delivered to the Slovak Geological Institute. In the application for granting the permission to execute geological works, the natural person will state: a) name and surname, permanent residence, personal identification number, if a responsible representative has been named, also the data relative to that person; if the application is submitted by a person registered in the trade register, the printout from this register will be attached too; b) the trade name; c) the basic subject of competence; d) the kind of geological works; e) identification number, if it was allocated; f) material equipment; g) time of completion of the execution, projection and evaluation of geological works, if the person intends to perform the competence within a specified period. In the application for granting the permission to execute geological works, the legal unit will state: a) the trade name, headquarters, the legal form, as well as the name and residence of the person or persons who are a statutory representative of the legal unit, the way how they will act in the name of the person and other data on the responsible representative; b) identification number; c) the basic subject of competence; d) the kind of geological works; e) the material equipment; f) time of completion of the competence, if assumed that the geological works are indented to be projected, executed and evaluated within a specified period. On request of the founders, or the organs or persons authorized to render the entry of a Czecho-slovak legal unit into the trade register, the license on the execution, projection and evaluation of geological works will be issued before the entry into the register and proof of the founding of the legal unit will be attached. To the application for granting the permission to execute geological works, the following items will be attached by:  a) the natural person – document indicating expert competence, if need be the document indicating the expert competence of the statutory representative; b) the legal unit – the document indicating the expert competence of the statutory representative.

Policy: Loi nº 92-613 modifiant le Code forestier et portant diverses dispositions agricoles et cynégétiques.
Policy_Content: Cette loi vise principalement à renforcer la lutte contre les incendies de forêts, moyennant notamment des opérations de débroussaillement et des travaux d'aménagement et d'équipement. Elle définit le débroussaillement comme étant soit la destruction, par tous moyens, des broussailles et morts-bois; soit la suppression ou l'élagage de végétaux ou d'essences forestières pouvant provoquer la propagation des incendies. Dans les communes où se trouvent des bois classés, le débroussaillement est obligatoire, en particulier, aux abords des chantiers et installations sur une profondeur de cinquante mètres, ainsi que dans les zones urbaines délimitées par un plan d'occupation des sols. Lorsque les incendies risquent, dans certains massifs, de compromettre la sécurité publique ou de dégrader les sols et les peuplements forestiers, les travaux d'aménagement et d'équipement destinés à prévenir les incendies, à limiter leurs conséquences ou à reconstituer les forêts sont déclarés d'utilité publique et réalisés aux frais de la collectivité publique qui en fait la demande. Peuvent également faire l'objet d'une déclaration d'utilité publique, dans les mêmes conditions, les travaux d'aménagement qui contribuent au cloisonnement de ces massifs.

Policy: Law No. 657-XII on sanitary supervision.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates relations for the ensuring sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population and radiation safety, safeguarding man’s right to favourable environment. The Act consists of six Sections divided into 32 articles: (1) general provisions; (2) the right of citizens to favourable environment and guarantees of its realization; (3) requirements for ensuring sanitary and epidemiological well-being, radiation safety of the population and the duties for the realization thereof; (4) the state sanitary supervision and control; (5) liability; and (6) international agreements. Basic principles for ensuring sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population shall be: (a) prevention of negative environmental impact on human health; (b) environmental impact assessment (EIA); (c) liability and compensation for environmental damage and as its consequence negative impact on human health. Citizens shall be guaranteed access to information on the state of environment and radiation level.

Policy: Regional Act No. 19 establishing and regulating the functions of Mountain Communities.

The regional mountain territories are classified into 19 areas. Article 2, paragraph 2, establishes 19 Mountain Communities corresponding to said areas. Title II regulates the organization of the Mountain Communities. They shall in particular: a) encourage the development of their territories; b) endeavour to improve the environmental quality as well as the potentials of their mountain habitats; c) elaborate schemes aimed at the improvement of mountain resources; d) ensure the participation of the local population to the social and economic development of mountain areas. Policy: Constitution of the Republic of Estonia.
Policy_Content: Estonia is an independent and sovereign democratic republic wherein supreme political authority is vested in the people. The independence and sovereignty of Estonia are timeless and inalienable (Article 1). The land, territorial waters and airspace of Estonia constitute an inseparable and indivisible whole (Article 2). The natural wealth and resources of Estonia are national riches which must be used economically (Article 5). It consists of 168 Articles divided into 15 Chapters: General Principles (I);Fundamental Rights, Freedoms and Duties (II); The People (III); The Riigikogu (Legislative Authority) (IV); The President (V); The Government of the Republic (VI); Legislation (VII); Finance and the National Budget (VIII); Foreign Relations and International Treaties (IX); National Defence (X); The National Audit Office (XI); The Chancellor of Justice (XII); The Courts (XIII); Local Self-Government (XIV); and Amendments of the Constitution (XV). Everyone is entitled to protection of his or her health. Every citizen of Estonia is entitled to government assistance in the case of old age, incapacity for work, loss of provider, or need. The categories and extent of the assistance, and the conditions and procedure for its allocation are provided by law. Unless otherwise provided by law, citizens of foreign states and stateless persons in Estonia enjoy this right equally with citizens of Estonia. The national government facilitates voluntary provision of welfare services and provision of welfare services by local authorities. Families with a large number of children as well as people with disabilities enjoy special care of the national government and of local authorities (Article 28). Policy: Decreto Nº 39/92 - Establece una moratoria forestal.
Policy_Content: La moratoria forestal que establece el presente Decreto está motivada por el problema de la deforestación, que en los últimos años ha alcanzado niveles intolerables. En adelante queda prohibido en todo el territorio nacional el corte de todo tipo de madera para actividades comerciales. Se excluyen de esta resolución el corte de madera por el dueño de la propiedad para satisfacer sus propias necesidades, el que ya se esté realizando bajo planes de manejo previamente aprobados y el que se efectúe para fines energéticos. Se podrán asimismo aprobar excepcionalmente las solicitudes de aprovechamiento forestal que se encuentren en trámite al momento de entrar en vigor el presente Decreto. A partir de la entrada en vigencia de la moratoria los titulares de permisos de corte tendrán un plazo de 30 días para presentar un inventario detallado de la madera que hayan cortado. Terminado ese plazo sólo se consentirá el transporte de la madera incluida en los inventarios.

Policy_Content: For the purpose of the present Act “agricultural operation" means an agricultural, aquacultural, horticultural or silvicultural operation that is carried on in the expectation of gain or reward. Policy: Strategic Environmental Plan (SEP) for Palawan Act (No. 7611).
Policy_Content: It is hereby declared the policy of the State to protect, develop and conserve natural resources (sect. 2). A comprehensive plan for the Palawan province is hereby adopted based on a philosophy of sustainable development for Palawan and the conservation of life supporting ecosystems. An integrated approach to problems and issues shall be adopted. The Plan shall serve as a framework for government agencies concerned with the formulation and implementation of plans. The Plan shall establish a "graded system of protection and development control over Palawan including tribal lands, mangroves, seabed, etc. This system shall be known as the Environmentally Critical Areas Network (ECAN). Areas covered by ECAN shall be classified into 3 components: terrestrial, Coastal /marine areas, and tribal ancestral lands (sect. 8). The second part of the Act concerns management of resources outside of ecologically critical areas. Other provisions deal with the Palawan Council for Sustainable Development created under section 16 and conversion of an existing office to the Council. (21 sections)

Policy: Champagne and Aishihik First Nations Final Agreement.
Policy_Content: The present Final Agreement between the Government of Canada, the Champagne and Aishihik First Nations and the Government of the Yukon is made under section 35 of the Constitution Act and sets out the rights of the First Nations Champagne and Aishihik and its people and in particular ways in which the federal, territorial and First Nation governments interact. Chapter 11 deals with land use planning establishing that its objectives are as follows to: 1) encourage the development of a common Yukon land use planning process outside community boundaries; 2) minimize actual or potential land use conflicts both within Settlement Land and Non-Settlement Land and between Settlement Land and Non-Settlement Land; 3) recognize and promote the cultural values of Yukon Indian People; 4) utilize the knowledge and experience of Yukon Indian People in order to achieve effective land use planning; 5) recognize Yukon First Nations' responsibilities pursuant to Settlement Agreements for the use and management of Settlement Land; and 6) ensure that social, cultural, economic and environmental policies are applied to the management, protection and use of land, water and resources in an integrated and coordinated manner so as to ensure Sustainable Development. The text consists of 28 chapters as follows: Definitions (1); General provisions (2); Eligibility and enrolment (3); Reserves and land set aside (4); Tenure and management of settlement land (5); Access (6); Expropriation (7); Surface Right Board (8); Settlement Land Amount (9); Special Management Areas (10); Land Use Planning (11); Development Assessment (12); Heritage (13); Water Management (14); Definition of Boundaries and Measurement of Areas of Settlement Land (15); Fish and Wildlife (16); Forest Resources (17); Non-Renewable Resources (18); Financial Compensation (19); Taxation (20); Taxation of Settlement Land (21); Economic Development Measures (22); Resource Royalty Sharing (23); Yukon Indian Self-Government (24); Transboundary Agreements (25); Dispute Resolution (26); Yukon Fish and Wildlife Enhancement Trust (27); Implementation and Training for Settlement Implementation (28). Two Annexes are enclosed.

Policy: Provisions on the Rights and Duties in Forestry Resources Management at Village Level.
Policy_Content: The present provisions regulate the management of forestry resources (trees, water, land and wildlife) by main village administrative authorities. The latter shall, inter alia: organize and direct the village forestry agency in charge of the management of forests and forest land, monitor and collect information on forestry activities within the village, study and promulgate consequent and appropriate rules on village forest management, etc. According to the provisions of article 9, "through appropriate rural development methods, the use of degraded forest land and vacant land shall be managed by the village administrative authorities and its population for agricultural production, animal husbandry, improvement and development of forests". Furthermore, article 12 establishes the right of the population to receive benefits, such as gathering of forestry product, cutting wood for firewood, coal, etc., hunting non-protected animals. Chapter V makes restriction on the use of forest land, forest clearing at water sources or along roads, mountain slopes, water ponds and in dense forests.
Subject: Forestry, Water

Policy: Tasks, Rights, Duties and Responsibilities of the Municipal Agriculture and Forestry Services.
Policy_Content: The provincial and municipal agriculture and forestry services are in charge of the management of agriculture and forestry with respect to technical management, personnel management, plan, budget and salaries. Main tasks of the provincial and municipal agriculture and forestry services are: to study and supervise the implementation of strategies and plans, to carry out surveys for the classification of agriculture and forestry areas, supervise and promote research, coordinate with concerned sectors and divisions. Within said framework, Part II, III and IV concern, respectively, the duties and rights, the organizational structure and the work system of the provincial and municipal agriculture and forestry services.

Policy: Law No. 2456-XII on natural reserves.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the Ukrainian legislation on natural reserves is to regulate social relations as regards organization, protection and use of areas and sites pertaining to natural reserves, creation of their natural complexes and management in this sphere. Nature reserves are defined areas of land and water, natural ecosystems and other objects representing special environmental, scientific, aesthetic, recreational and other value that have been separated for the purpose of protection of natural landscapes, genetic fund of wildlife and plant species, maintaining ecological balance and ensuring environmental monitoring. The Law consists of 11 Sections that contain 67 articles. Section 1(arts. 1-10) lays down general provisions. Section 2 (arts. 11-13) regards management in the sphere of organization, protection and use of natural reserves. Section 3 (arts. 14-38) regards the status of natural reserves. Section 4 (arts. 39-40) regards protection of natural reserves. Sec 5 (arts. 41-43) regards research activity in the natural reserves. Section 6 (arts. 44-50) regards financing of organization and functioning of natural reserves. Section 7 (arts. 51-55) establishes the modalities of setting up and proclamation of natural reserves. Section 8 (arts. 56-59) regards state register of territories and sites pertaining to natural reserves. Section 9 (arts. 60-63) regards protection of natural reserves and control over the observance of their status. Section 10 (arts. 64-65) establishes liability for the infringement of the legislation on natural reserves. Section 11 (arts. 66-67) regards international cooperation in the sphere of protection and utilization of the territories and sites pertaining to natural reserves.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
